channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Bangladeshi worker dies in accident at LTA construction site next to Changi MRT depot
item.description:
December 15, 2020 9:04 PM

The man and his co-workers were extracting sheet piles when a part of a sheet pile broke and fell on him.

item.title: Singapore to see less wet weather for second half of December
item.description:
December 15, 2020 7:55 PM

Short thundery showers are expected over parts of Singapore in the afternoon on most days.

item.title: Singapore, Vietnam plan to launch green lane for business and official travel by next year
item.description:
December 15, 2020 6:53 PM

Singapore will be among the first few countries with whom Vietnam will resume regularised essential business and official travel.

item.title: Shared memories and community stories are focus of National Museum's new exhibition on Home
item.description:
December 15, 2020 6:49 PM

Home, Truly: Growing Up With Singapore, 1950s To The Present explores what living and growing up in Singapore has been like for people across different generations.

item.title: Police warn against holding protests without permits in support of foreign causes
item.description:
December 15, 2020 6:43 PM

Police are investigating protests held in several locations in Singapore in support of farmers in India.

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on Dec 15
item.description:
December 15, 2020 6:34 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Tuesday, Dec 15.

item.title: More patients with chronic health conditions willing to take up telemonitoring: SingHealth Polyclinics
item.description:
December 15, 2020 6:25 PM

SINGAPORE - Patients with chronic health conditions such as diabetes have shown increased willingness to take up telemonitoring, a trend which is needed to help curb rising morbidity and mortality in Singapore's ageing population.

item.title: 131 inmates receive National Youth Achievement Award
item.description:
December 15, 2020 6:00 PM

SINGAPORE - He was jailed two years ago for gang-related activities, but Adam (not his real name) has turned a new leaf and isnow studying hard behind bars.

item.title: No abuse of power in how foreign halal certification boards are recognised: Muis
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:42 PM

But in the interest of accountability and transparency, the council has referred the allegations to the Corrupt Practices Investigation Bureau.

item.title: Citi Singapore raises almost $400,000 for ChildAid in 2020
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:39 PM

The bank launched the Citi & Partners Support ChildAid initiative in November, roping in Dell, NICE and WWT.

item.title: Man jailed in August for Covid-19-related offences sentenced to 2 more years' jail for molestation
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:35 PM

Sethu Selvaraj molested an Indonesian domestic helper as she was walking back to her employer's flat in Petir Road.

item.title: Segregated business travel lane: Small impact on S'pore's economy, but crucial in building confidence, say experts
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:23 PM

The move is all the more important as Singapore prepares to host the World Economic Forum in May next year, experts said.

item.title: Singapore helps seize $5 million in illicit funds linked to Canadian group providing 'uncrackable phones'
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:21 PM

The money was seized from 4 bank accounts in Singapore belonging to Phantom Secure.

item.title: Former Shell employee admits to involvement in gas oil misappropriation worth $49 million
item.description:
December 15, 2020 3:50 PM

Sadagopan Premnath received about US$150,000 for his involvement in the plot and has not made restitution.

item.title: Restrictions on work from office may be eased in phase 3, more updates soon: Josephine Teo
item.description:
December 15, 2020 3:45 PM

Mrs Teo also gave an update on the SGUnited Mid-Career Pathways Programme, saying it has gained momentum, "but not as fast as we would like".

item.title: 16 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 1 from worker dorm
item.description:
December 15, 2020 3:36 PM

There were 15 imported cases who had been placed on stay-home notices on arrival in Singapore.

item.title: Singapore, Australian defence ministers mark 30 years of SAF training in Queensland
item.description:
December 15, 2020 1:55 PM

Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen and Australian Defence Minister Linda Reynolds met virtually to commemorate the occasion.

item.title: NYP student admits to recording upskirt video of woman in bus
item.description:
December 15, 2020 1:23 PM

The 19-year-old pleaded guilty to a voyeurism charge.

item.title: Secondary 1 posting results to be released at 9am on Dec 22
item.description:
December 15, 2020 12:15 PM

Students do not need to report to their new schools in person the day after receiving their results

item.title: Singapore to launch segregated lane for business travellers who will not need to be quarantined
item.description:
December 15, 2020 11:43 AM

Those using the lane will be transported from the airport to dedicated facilities where they will stay and work.

item.title: TraceTogether tokens not compulsory for students when schools reopen in January
item.description:
December 15, 2020 10:03 AM

The tokens will be required in schools only when all of them have been distributed nationwide.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Dec 15
item.description:
December 15, 2020 8:00 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Tuesday, Dec 15.

item.title: Much lower Covid-19 prevalence rate in community than among migrant workers, according to study
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Unlike the migrant worker population - where almost 50 per cent of those staying in dormitories have tested positive for Covid-19 - the prevalence rate of the virus in the larger community is much smaller, the Health Ministry's director of medical services Kenneth Mak said yesterday.

item.title: Answers to key questions on vaccination strategy
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Q Why is the vaccination programme voluntary and not mandatory? How does the Government hope to encourage greater public acceptance of vaccination apart from getting it free?

item.title: New book of essays on role of Malays in Singapore's history
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A new book of essays chronicling Singapore's bicentennial journey and the role of the Malay/Muslim community in its history was launched yesterday.

item.title: Local attractions can apply to raise capacity up to 65%
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Local attractions can apply to increase their operating capacity from 50 per cent to up to 65 per cent when Singapore enters phase three from Dec 28, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: Five new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, all imported
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Five new coronavirus cases were confirmed yesterday, taking Singapore's total to 58,325.

item.title: Man admits to obstructing justice by disposing of T-shirt
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A man among a group of seven people linked to the Orchard Towers murder in July last year pleaded guilty yesterday to obstructing justice by disposing of a bloodstained T-shirt worn by another man involved in the incident.

item.title: Much lower Covid-19 prevalence rate in wider community in Singapore than among migrant workers, sampling study shows
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Almost 50 per cent of those living in dormitories have tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Mufti: Religious guidance clear on allowing Muslims to take vaccines
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's Mufti, the highest Islamic authority here, has made an executive decision to permit Covid-19 vaccines for Muslims here, regardless of their ingredients, due to the urgency of the situation.

item.title: S'poreans urged to stay vigilant and abide by rules to curb virus
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has an important message for Singaporeans as they gear up for phase three of the country's reopening: Stay cautious and vigilant, continue to cooperate with the Government and abide by the rules to keep the virus at bay.

item.title: 3 water feature maintenance firms fined over bid rigging
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Three water feature maintenance companies have been fined by the competition watchdog for conducting cartel-style bid-rigging activities for close to a decade.

item.title: Migrant workers can return to community once a month in pilot
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Migrant workers in some dormitories will be able to return to the community once a month in a pilot scheme starting in the first quarter of next year, the authorities announced yesterday.

item.title: Singaporeans welcome move to phase 3, some remain wary of further easing of safety measures
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Groups and workplaces that operate in teams said this would mark a return to some normality.

item.title: Regional interfaith exchange programme kicks off
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The second edition of a regional interfaith exchange programme which brings together 30 participants of different faiths from Asean nations was launched yesterday by President Halimah Yacob.

item.title: Nearly half of migrant workers in dormitories have had Covid-19
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Almost half of migrant workers staying in dormitories have had a Covid-19 infection, the authorities said yesterday.

item.title: Community Chest Awards honour firms, individuals for helping vulnerable groups
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Since 2002, the Singtel Touching Lives Fund has raised over $45 million to help children and youth with special needs acquire skills to lead independent lives.

item.title: 331 Mindef volunteers lauded for contributions
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Besides leading Singapore's Covid-19 effort at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases, Professor Leo Yee Sin also keeps herself updated on measures put in place at army camps to curb the spread of such diseases.

item.title: 252 nabbed for various offences in police dragnet
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 252 people have been arrested for various offences during a 16-day enforcement operation led by Bedok Police Division.

item.title: S'poreans welcome move towards further reopening
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans welcomed the move towards the next phase of reopening, while remaining realistic about the chances of measures to curb the spread of Covid-19 - such as mask wearing and travel restrictions - being lifted any time soon.

item.title: Free Covid-19 vaccinations for Singaporeans: 8 key questions on Singapore's planned roll-out
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Why is the vaccination programme voluntary and not mandatory? Is there a target take-up rate?

item.title: S'pore, France working on reciprocal green lane for business, official travel
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and France are wor-king on a reciprocal green lane for short-term business and official trips.

item.title: Skill up to step up: Mum of four returns to school at 31 to fulfil dream
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite doing well in the Express stream in secondary school, Mrs Kousalya Selvakumar, 34, had to give up her studies when she had her first child at the age of 16.

item.title: Singapore to begin phase 3 on Dec 28
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will enter phase three of its reopening in two weeks, on Dec 28, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said yesterday.

item.title: Mum of four returns to school at 31 to fulfil dream
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In this first of a four-part series on reskilling and upskilling, The Straits Times talks to a housewife who went to the Institute of Technical Education at age 31 to pursue her dream of becoming a staff nurse.

item.title: HSA okays use of Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine, will keep monitoring safety
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The Health Sciences Authority (HSA) yesterday approved the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine in Singapore, and said it will keep monitoring it to ensure that it continues to be safe for use.

item.title: Getting a jab: A case for sooner or later?
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

It is great news that Singapore has secured enough Covid-19 vaccines for everyone here, with the first vaccines slated to arrive by the year end.

item.title: Free, voluntary vaccinations for all Singaporeans, long-term residents
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Free Covid-19 vaccinations will be offered to all Singaporeans and long-term residents who are currently here, though they will be voluntary, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said yesterday.

item.title: Bangladeshi gets death for murder of girlfriend
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A Bangladeshi worker was sentenced to death yesterday after he was found guilty of murdering his Indonesian girlfriend.

item.title: Singapore to let in more travellers in bid to retain air hub status
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

More travellers will be allowed to enter or transit through Singapore as part of efforts to reconnect to the world and preserve the Republic's status as an air hub.

item.title: Singapore to play crucial role in transporting vaccines around world
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

As a global aviation hub, Singapore will play a crucial role in transporting Covid-19 vaccines around the world, said Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.

item.title: Opening of TEL's 2nd stage delayed until Q3 next year
item.description:
December 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A signalling fault that disrupted train services on the Thomson-East Coast Line (TEL) on Dec 4 has led to a delay in the opening of the second stage of the line.

item.title: 47 per cent of migrant workers in S'pore dorms have had a Covid-19 infection, say Manpower and Health Ministries
item.description:
December 15, 2020 12:01 AM

Serology tests for about 65,000 workers in dorms who had not taken them before were still being carried out.
